alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 1:19AM EST until January 01 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16 affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lake Kedron Tailrace, Lake Horton, Lovejoy, Americus, Lake Peachtree Tailrace, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Below Lake McIntosh, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin Hwy. 16, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville Hwy. 19, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 11.9 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning to 12.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning to 11.8 feet and begin rising again this afternoon. It will rise to 12.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to 6.7 feet and begin rising again early Tuesday afternoon. It will rise to 6.9 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 09/19/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
